page.title: 09ALL SAINTS CHURCH,WITLEY
page.content: Some form of Christian church has existed in Witley since the seventh century. The oldest part of the church is the{Nave.}In the stone walls are two original Saxon windows.Over the centuries,other parts have been added. When you walk into the church,you suddenly feel cold because of the stone.There is a lovely polished smell.You can see the{font.}This is an octagonal shape and dates from the thirteenth century.There are wonderful stained glass windows.On the walls are twelfth century{wall paintings }which were uncovered in 1889.The paintings were put on to wet plaster.In 1917,conservation work caused the paintings to darken and blister.The paintings show episodes from the life of Jesus.Inside the church,there are three graves dating from about 1200.
